name: Sociology of Law and Lawyers
description: This lecture course examines law and society through the lens of the legal profession. Law represents one of our most elite and influential professions; lawyers are responsible not only for the administration of justice, but also are key players in the country's economic and political life. This course will rely on empirical research to cover topics related to law school, where lawyers work and the work that they do. [24L]
prerequisites: SOC205H5/231H5, 209H5, 221H5, 222H5, 0.5 SOC credit at the 300 level
